item.title: Anjuelle add a quote by C.G. Jung
item.description: "Your visions will become clear only when you can look into your own heart. Who looks outside, dreams; who looks inside, awakes." -- C.G. Jung

item.title: Anjuelle add a quote by Kerry E. Wagner
item.description: "you don't have to worry about burning bridges, if you're building your own" -- Kerry E. Wagner

item.title: Anjuelle add a quote by Sarah Vowell
item.description: "I no longer drink nearly as much as I used to but, still, my motto is Sine coffea nihil sum. Without coffee, I'm nothing." -- Sarah Vowell

item.title: Anjuelle add a quote by Erick S. Gray
item.description: "Whatever you give a woman, she will make greater. If you give her sperm, she'll give you a baby.. If you give her a house, she'll give you a home. If you give her groceries, she'll give you a meal. If you give her a smile, she'll give you her heart. She multiplies and enlarges what is given to her. So, if you give her any crap, be ready to receive a ton of shit!" -- Erick S. Gray

item.title: Anjuelle add a quote by Bernard M. Baruch
item.description: "Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter, and those who matter don't mind." -- Bernard M. Baruch

item.title: Anjuelle add a quote by Erick S. Gray
item.description: "Be more concerned with your character than your reputation, because your character is what you really are, while your reputation is merely what others think you are." -- Erick S. Gray

item.title: Anjuelle add a quote by Carter Godwin Woodson
item.description: "History shows that it does not matter who is in power or what revolutionary forces take over the government, those who have not learned to do for themselves and have to depend solely on others never obtain any more rights or privileges in the end than they had in the beginning." -- Carter Godwin Woodson

item.title: Anjuelle add a quote by Anne Lamott
item.description: "Forgiveness is giving up all hope of having had a better past." -- Anne Lamott

item.title: Anjuelle add a quote by Anne Lamott
item.description: "Perfectionism is the voice of the oppressor, the enemy of the people. It will keep you cramped and insane your whole life, and it is the main obstacle between you and a shitty first draft. I think perfectionism is based on the obsessive belief that if you run carefully enough, hitting each stepping-stone just right, you won't have to die. The truth is that you will die anyway and that a lot of people who aren't even looking at their feet are going to do a whole lot better than you, and have a lot more fun while they're doing it." -- Anne Lamott

item.title: Anjuelle add a quote by Anjuelle Floyd
item.description: "It is not until you become a mother that your judgment slowly turns to compassion and understanding. - Erma Bombeck" -- Anjuelle Floyd

item.title: Anjuelle add a quote by Rumi
item.description: "In your light I learn how to love. In your beauty, how to make poems. You dance inside my chest where no-one sees you, but sometimes I do, and that sight becomes this art." -- Rumi
